definitions.text: the upper part of anything
examples: the mower cuts off the tops of the grass
the title should be written at the top of the first page

definitions.text: the highest or uppermost side of anything
examples: put your books on top of the desk
only the top side of the box was painted

definitions.text: the top or extreme point of something (usually a mountain or hill)
examples: the view from the peak was magnificent
they clambered to the tip of Monadnock
the region is a few molecules wide at the summit

definitions.text: the first half of an inning; while the visiting team is at bat
examples: a relief pitcher took over in the top of the fifth

definitions.text: the highest level or degree attainable; the highest stage of development
examples: his landscapes were deemed the acme of beauty
the artist's gifts are at their acme
at the height of her career
the peak of perfection
summer was at its peak
...catapulted Einstein to the pinnacle of fame
the summit of his ambition
so many highest superlatives achieved by man
at the top of his profession

definitions.text: the greatest possible intensity
examples: he screamed at the top of his lungs

definitions.text: platform surrounding the head of a lower mast
a conical child's plaything tapering to a steel point on which it can be made to spin
examples: he got a bright red top and string for his birthday

definitions.text: covering for a hole (especially a hole in the top of a container)
examples: he removed the top of the carton
he couldn't get the top off of the bottle
put the cover back on the kettle

definitions.text: a garment (especially for women) that extends from the shoulders to the waist or hips
examples: he stared as she buttoned her top

definitions.text: a canvas tent to house the audience at a circus performance
examples: he was afraid of a fire in the circus tent
they had the big top up in less than an hour

definitions.text: be superior or better than some standard
examples: She exceeded our expectations
She topped her performance of last year

definitions.text: pass by, over, or under without making contact
examples: the balloon cleared the tree tops

definitions.text: be at the top of or constitute the top or highest point
examples: A star tops the Christmas Tree

definitions.text: be ahead of others; be the first
examples: she topped her class every year

definitions.text: provide with a top or finish the top (of a structure)
examples: the towers were topped with conical roofs

definitions.text: reach or ascend the top of
examples: The hikers topped the mountain just before noon

definitions.text: strike (the top part of a ball in golf, baseball, or pool) giving it a forward spin
cut the top off
examples: top trees and bushes

definitions.text: be the culminating event
examples: The speech crowned the meeting

definitions.text: finish up or conclude
examples: They topped off their dinner with a cognac
top the evening with champagne

definitions.text: situated at the top or highest position
examples: the top shelf
